list.name: Battery Quality
list.description: How long does the battery of a <replacer>-phone remain reliable? Is the battery easily replaceable? How does battery quality influence the overall lifespan and durability of a smartphone? What environmental and safety concerns arise from poor battery quality? How do manufacturers ensure battery quality while balancing cost and sustainability?
list.interpreter: The role of the smartphone's battery on the smartphones footprint

list.name: Durability
list.description: How long can the <replacer>-phone remain functional and relevant? How resistant is it to physical damage? What is the estimated livespan?
list.interpreter: What factors contribute to the durability of a smartphone, and how is it measured? What role do material choices and design play in enhancing smartphone durability?

list.name: Planned Obsolescence
list.description: Does the <replacer>-phone Company employ strategies, such as performance-reducing software updates, to encourage users to replace their phones within a few years?
list.interpreter: What are the different forms of planned obsolescence in the smartphone industry? What alternatives exist to planned obsolescence that still support technological progress?

list.name: Ease of Repair
list.description: How easy is it for the end user to repair the <replacer>-phone? Are there barriers implemented by the manufacturer?

list.name: Ease of Modification
list.description: Can the <replacer>-phone's performance be upgraded by the user?
list.interpreter: What impact do modular designs and replaceable components have on repairability? What are the barriers preventing greater modifiability and user-repairable smartphones?

list.name: Raw Materials Origin
list.description: Where are the natural resources used in the <replacer>-phone production coming from? Specifically, where are the mines located for rare earth elements used in metal extraction? What are the key metals used in smartphones, and why are they essential for ICT industries? How does the sourcing of raw materials, raw earths and minerals impact local communities and ecosystems?
list.interpreter: How can transparency in raw material sourcing contribute to a more sustainable industry?

list.name: Transportation
list.description: What are the distances involved, not only between production sites, but also to the final point of distribution of <replacer>-Smartphones? Which transport vehicles are used?
list.interpreter: What are the main logistical challenges in making smartphone supply chains more sustainable? How can manufacturers reduce the carbon footprint of transporting raw materials and finished products? What role do alternative transportation methods, such as low-emission shipping, play in reducing environmental impact?

list.name: Manufactoring
list.description: What processes are used to transform raw resources into consumer electronics? This includes intermediate products and the assembly of the final smartphone. How does the <replacer>-Company act to improve those, from a sustainable point of view?
list.interpreter: What are the most resource-intensive stages of smartphone manufacturing? How do energy consumption, waste production and emissions from manufacturing affect the industry's sustainability? What parts impact the footprint the most?

list.name: Recycled Parts
list.description: To what extent are the parts of a <replacer>-phone recycled?

list.name: Sustainable Innovativity
list.description: What does the manufacturer of the <replacer>-phone do for the environment? Does the <replacer>-phone has unique innovations in terms of enabling increased sustainability?

list.name: Estimated Carbon Footprint
list.description: What is the estimated carbon footprint of a <replacer>-phone per year? Can you give me any figures? If it aligns with industry standards, what are they?
list.interpreter: Are figures mentioned regarding the carbon footprint?
